keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, a founding member and bassist of Limp Bizkit, died at the age of 48.
Rivers was instrumental in shaping the band's sound, particularly noted for his mastery of the five-string bass and his role as a central creative force.
He left the band in 2015 due to severe liver disease caused by excessive drinking, underwent treatment, and received a successful liver transplant in 2018 before rejoining the group.
His return to Limp Bizkit in 2018 demonstrated his resilience and commitment to music, reinforcing his significance to the band’s legacy.
Rivers' death was confirmed by Limp Bizkit, who described him as a 'true legend of legends' and emphasized his lasting influence on their music and identity.
The band's 2025 hit single 'Making Love to Morgan Wallen' topped several Billboard charts, reflecting the continued relevance and popularity of Limp Bizkit in the music industry.
Fred Durst recalled the first time he saw Rivers play at a Jacksonville bar, describing it as a transformative moment that led to the formation of Limp Bizkit.
Rivers' last social media post was a 'Save The Date' video for a June 2026 performance in Hradec Králové, indicating active involvement in the band’s future plans.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the founding bassist and a key creative force behind the nu-metal band Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48. The band confirmed his death, honoring him as a 'true legend of legends' and emphasizing his vital role in shaping their sound and identity. Rivers left the band in 2015 due to severe liver disease caused by excessive drinking, underwent treatment, and received a successful liver transplant before rejoining the group in 2018. His last known social media post was a 'Save The Date' for a performance at the Rock for People festival in Hradec Králové, Czech Republic, in June 2026. The band's 2025 single 'Making Love to Morgan Wallen' topped multiple Billboard charts, reflecting their ongoing influence. Fred Durst recalled meeting Rivers at a Jacksonville bar, where Rivers' skill on a five-string bass left a lasting impression and led to the formation of Limp Bizkit.
title: Sam Rivers, Bassist and Founding Member of Limp Bizkit, Dies Aged 48
